info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 27 at 4:29PM EDT until August 27 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Catawba County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Eastern Alexander County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Iredell County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 429 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles southeast of Taylorsville, or near Stony Point, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Statesville, Taylorsville, Conover, Troutman, Stony Point, Claremont, Catawba, Love Valley, Lake Norman State Park and Lookout Shoals Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
